3. They are deservedly to be blamed, who do not apply themselves to sacred learning, which alone is wont to im- bue the minds of rnen with this art of speaking wisely. For that salt is hidden in the word: and thence 311 wisdom is to be derived, which may be salutary either to the pos- sessor himself, or to others. Hence you will perceive with how great wickedness the Romanists surround themselves, who take away the salt of the Divine word from the people : for by that same act they impose upon themselves the necessity as it were both of thinking and speaking foofishly, to whom God gives it in command both to acquire knowledge and speech seasoned with salt to promote the advantage of their neighbours.
